article.headline: West Virginia 78, Radford 44
article.story: MORGANTOWN, W.Va. (AP) -- Mike Gansey scored 15 points and West Virginia breezed to a 78-44 victory over Radford on Saturday night. Tyrone Sally added 13 points for West Virginia, which is 4-0 for the first time under third-year coach John Beilein. Kevin Pittsnogle scored 12 points and Darris Nichols and Patrick Beilein had 10 apiece. Radford (4-2) scored just 17 points in the second half, shooting 30 percent from the floor. West Virginia trailed 8-0 early, but went on a 13-0 run midway through the first half for a 28-22 lead. The Mountaineers led 43-27 at halftime and Radford got no closer than 13 in the second half. West Virginia put the game out of reach with a 10-0 run midway through the period. Whit Holcomb-Faye led Radford with 16 points and Chris Oliver scored 14.<

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
